text: date: tue 11/23/1999 12:02 pm from steven walker (azmildman@abacusnet.net)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: y2k disasteri have to agree. the movie really made no sense. ("a true y2k disaster: the movie," 20.nov.1999). some guy who is a computer malfunction expert goes inside the reactor to try to prevent the disaster. they should have sent someone from programming to prevent this disaster. the only thing that this movie might have done was help perpetuate the y2k myth. (i guess someone who is so old that they think computers are evil machines – and that rush limbaugh has a chance of becoming our best president – might have gotten frightened.) my eight-year-old saw through it in two minutes, started pointing out mistakes they made and asked to turn it off after about two minutes and 30 seconds. but, the only fear i have is that the same people might be allowed to make another movie. china syndrome rip-off with a year 2000 twist.
